org.validator.engine

Class ValidatorEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.validator.engine.ValidatorEngine

  • public class ValidatorEngine
extends java.lang.Object
    The ValidatorEngine orchestrates the test process. Each DBObject in the RefreshRequest is validated using by this orchestration. The results are serialised using Java Architecture for XML Binding.
    Author:
    danielgalassi@gmail.com

      • setResultsFolder

        public void setResultsFolder(java.lang.String resultCatalogLocation)
        Sets the internal directory all results will be saved to.
        Parameters:
        resultCatalogLocation - path to the target directory

      • run

        public void run()
        Executes the validation of the refresh request. The validation process consists of the following steps: 1. matching of each DBObject against the master list of reference data 2. identifies whether the schema was included in the object column (common mistake) 3. identifies whether the object name was entered with quotation marks (common mistake) 4. identifies incorrect object types (table instead of a view, etc.) 5. identifies incorrect schemas (table found in a different schema than that in the request) Upon completion, an index document (catalog) is created. Each entry in this catalog points to a result file.

      • serialiseResults

        private void serialiseResults()
        JAXB serialisation of the validation results

      • ready

        private boolean ready()
        Validates the engine has been fully setup to avoid triggering a process without a loaded request or without a target directory for the results
        Returns:
        true if all dependencies are met
